results.title: Bifo Kam
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Graham Chase
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
One of a series on the Solomon Islands, this film is concerned with the traditional culture of the Solomon Islands. It shows the construction of a canoe at Taumako, and the making of feather money which is used for dowry payments. Narrated by Alfred Aihunu; photography by Dean Semler. English commentary, Solomon Islands dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Bicycles down the years
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: An introduction to the history of the bicycle, looking at some of the technical and social changes in the past one hundred and twenty years. Bill Sidebottom and Doug McCann from Museum of Victoria present a collection of vintage and veteran bicycles to tell the story.

results.title: Bicycles are beautiful
results.creator_credit: Crommie and Crommie and Lee Mendelson
results.brief_description: A very brief history of bicycling in the USA featuring the National Safety Councils Bicycle Safety Test. Sponsored by McDonalds Family Restaurants. Hosted and narrated by Bill Cosby.

results.title: Bicycle stall in Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Australia, Ken J. Widdowson and John Gray
results.brief_description: Overviews the role of the bicycle by focusing on a family who earn their living by selling soup from a bycicle stall. The bicycle is also used as a means of transport for people and goods.

results.title: Bicycle
results.brief_description: This stylish and fast moving BBC series celebrates the spirit of freedom and presents the definitive story of humankind’s noblest invention. Six episodes of twenty minutes are presented on this tape: “Invention”: history and evolution of the modern bike from Leonardo to the safety bike of 1885, includes re-enactments and life-size working reproductions. “Wheels of change”: modern cycle design including the history of the mountain bike and the recumbent. “The Ultimate”: follow a season with champion rider Greg LeMond. Includes all the passion and hype of the Tour De France. “The Business”: Insight into bicycle manufacturers like Schwinn, Shimano, Raleigh and Peugot as well as the stars of the Japanese Keirin racing business. “Free Spirits”: The joys and sweetspots of cycling, why cyclists love it! “Vehicle for a small planet”: The compelling global argument for the mass return to the bicycle as the perfect green vehicle for a small planet.

results.title: Bicentennial man
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Touchstone Pictures, 1492 Pictures, Laurence Mark Productions, Radiant Productions, Wolfgang Petersen, Gail Katz, Neal E. Miller, Mark Radcliffe, Chris Columbus and Michael Barnathan
results.brief_description: Starring Robin Williams and Sam Neill, this is a futuristic tale set in the not so distant future when every home will have an NDR-114 robot - the latest technological advancement to serve man. This is the story of one NDR-114 robot, who came off the production line with a unique fault - he doesn’t want to be a robot, and his amazing 200-year journey to become human. Based on the short story and novel “The Positronic man” by Isaac Asimov.

results.title: Bias
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Catriona McKenzie, Steve Pasvolsky and Alice Addison
results.brief_description:
Two old men are playing for the champion’s rosette in lawn bowls when a snail interupts play and causes one codger to win and the other to lose. The battle takes on a greater moral dimension…Animation and live action.
Cast: Lisle Jones, John Keightley

results.title: Bhutan
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Stafford Garner
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
A trip to Bhutan, the mysterious, rarely filmed kingdom nestling in the folds of the great Himalayas. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: Bhowani Junction
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Pandro S. Berman and George Cukor
results.brief_description: In what is considered by many fans to be her best performance, Ava Gardner stars as the half-caste heroine Victoria Jones, a woman forced to make some painful life decisions in post Colonial India. Her relationship with three men; Colonel Savage (Stewart Granger) a British military man in charge of protecting trains crossing Bhowani Junction, fellow Anglo-Indian Patrick Taylor (Bill Travers), and Sikh communist Peter Illing who befriends Victoria after she kills a potential rapist in self defence - challenging her to assess where her loyalties and ethnicity lie. Adapted from the novel by John Masters.
